exercise.title: Router Config 1
exercise.name: router_config_1
exercise.description: Refresher on comprehending a router configuration.
exercise.tutorial:
Given three separate router configurations, construct a network map connecting all three devices to the internet. The map must include hostnames, interface labels and IP addresses.

On the defensive workstation, the configs are in the share in the Networking folder under Router_Config_1.

Please answer the questions below and upload your netmap at the bottom.

question.text: What routing protocol is being used?
Using the configuration for R1, subnet interface Ethernet0/1, what is the IP Address Range? Example Answer: 1.2.3.4 - 1.2.3.255
Using the configuration for R1, subnet interface Ethernet0/1, what is the CIDR? Answer in the format '/24' or '/25'
Using the configuration for R1, subnet interface Ethernet0/1, what is the IP of the first host?
Using the configuration for R1, subnet interface Ethernet0/1, what is the IP of the last host?
Using the configuration for R1, subnet interface Ethernet0/1, what is the subnet?
Using the configuration for R1, subnet interface Ethernet0/1, what is the broadcast?
Using the configuration for R1, subnet interface Ethernet0/1, how many hosts are there?
Using the configuration for R3, how many virtual terminal lines exist?

Using the configuration for R2, enter the sub-interfaces that exist on interface Ethernet0/2. Enter them below with each interface on its own line in numerical order. Example below: Ethernet0/1.1 Ethernet0/1.2 Ethernet0/1.3 Ethernet0/1.4
Using the configuration for R2, what are the usable IPs for interface Ethernet0/3? Separate the IP's with an 'and'.
Please take a screenshot of your network map and upload below.
